name: Colonel Cassandra Moore

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Damn Brotherhood, bunch of elitist jerks. What were we to do, leave good armor out in the wastes to rust?

topics.topic_text: I was, uh, just sightseeing. Sorry to bother you.
topics.response_text: Then I suggest you make your way back outside. My men have orders to shoot anyone caught sneaking around in sensitive areas.

topics.topic_text: Ambassador Crocker said to come see you about Freeside.
topics.response_text: You say Crocker sent you? Let me see... I just received a memo regarding him recently and haven't had a chance to read it in detail.

topics.topic_text: No ma'am.
topics.response_text: Good. When the task is done, report back to Crocker. My men have other orders and will return here on their own to make their report.

topics.topic_text: This plan seems awfully confrontational.
topics.response_text: Do you have any idea what our current situation is? As we speak there is a huge army of madmen not ten miles from here waiting to kill us all.

topics.topic_text: Nope. I'm to go to Freeside and shoot up some Kings.
topics.response_text: Not exactly. Give them the chance to do the right thing at least. Personally, I doubt they'll do it.

topics.topic_text: I've spoken to the Great Khans. Their new leader has agreed to fight for the NCR.
topics.response_text: Excellent. You've done very well indeed. These tribals will make useful machete fodder.

topics.topic_text: Not yet. I'm still working on it.
topics.response_text: Then stop wasting my time and get on it!

topics.topic_text: Yes, ma'am.
topics.response_text: Since the majority of my men are on assignment dealing with the Legion, I need someone to handle other matters that have arisen.

topics.topic_text: I'm a little busy at the moment.
topics.response_text: But not too busy to come all the way out here? I don't think so. Stay a while, and listen to my offer.

topics.topic_text: You could say we've had dealings.
topics.response_text: Then I don't need to tell you that they can be a pain in the ass.

topics.topic_text: I have a score to settle with them.
topics.response_text: Good, that anger is something I can use, and I think you may get a chance to settle your score sooner than you might have planned.

topics.topic_text: I might have heard of them. Remind me.
topics.response_text: They're a rowdy bunch, and pride themselves as warriors. The dark leather and horned helmets they wear are pretty distinctive.

topics.topic_text: What if I find they're committed to joining Caesar?
topics.response_text: Then you'll need to make sure none of them are left to do so. Any other questions?

topics.topic_text: Will I have any NCR support in this?
topics.response_text: I can't lend you any troops, but I've already sent word to quartermaster Bardon that you're to be given full access to our hardware.

topics.topic_text: No questions, ma'am.
topics.response_text: Good. I look forward to hearing of your progress.

topics.topic_text: No ma'am.
topics.response_text: Liza O'Malley at the Embassy may have some information for you as well.

topics.topic_text: The Khans won't be a problem to anyone ever again.
topics.response_text: Good riddance. We've had reports for years that they're the ones who supply the Fiends with chems, but no one's done anything about it.

topics.topic_text: Where should I start?
topics.response_text: Head to their casino, Gomorrah, and ask around. If you discover that what they're up to threatens the NCR, stop it.

topics.topic_text: Can you give me any leads?
topics.response_text: Our preliminary research shows that the Omertas used to do some business in Freeside, mostly buying weapons. Any other questions?

topics.topic_text: They have a point, it is their armor. You should give it back.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Fine, this isn't worth the trouble to fight over.

topics.topic_text: The Omertas were up to something big, but I stopped them.
topics.response_text: Excellent. You'd think living in the lap of luxury and power would be enough for some people, but no.

topics.topic_text: I'm still working on it.
topics.response_text: The next time we speak, I expect you to have something for me.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> The Omertas are planning to attack New Reno. It's none of NCR's concern.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I wouldn't dismiss it that lightly, but it's nothing we need get involved with for now. Good work, I suppose.

topics.topic_text: I was hoping to ask you some questions.
topics.response_text: If you must, but please keep it brief.

topics.topic_text: Mr. House won't be a problem. He's been disconnected from his system.
topics.response_text: But he's still alive? I'll have to remember to send someone to follow up on that later. Anyway, at least he's out of the picture for the time being.

topics.topic_text: I killed Mr. House.
topics.response_text: Then that's one more nuisance we won't have to worry about. Good work. Our efforts haven't gone unnoticed, either.

topics.topic_text: I'm still working on it.
topics.response_text: I shouldn't have to say this, but please don't bother me until the mission is completed.

topics.topic_text: Is there no peaceful way to resolve this?
topics.response_text: {Player talked Khans into helping}No, just because you secured the aid of the Khans,{said under her breath}assuming they don't try to kill us, don't think the Brotherhood will be so easily swayed.

topics.topic_text: How do you expect me to destroy an entire Brotherhood chapter?
topics.response_text: A fair question, and one I've had our strategists think about for some time. Their consensus is that we must focus on the one thing we can count on.

topics.topic_text: I thought the Brotherhood were all wiped out at HELIOS One. How could they have survived?
topics.response_text: After the battle, we consolidated our hold on the plant before pursuing our enemies.

topics.topic_text: No ma'am.
topics.response_text: Dismissed.

topics.topic_text: The Brotherhood has been eliminated.
topics.response_text: {Triumph, relief}Ah, that's a relief. A Brotherhood attack while we're busy with the Legion would be catastrophic.

topics.topic_text: Not yet.
topics.response_text: Don't give up. They're out there, somewhere, and we're not safe until they've been destroyed.

topics.topic_text: I talked the Brotherhood into supporting the NCR.
topics.response_text: {She is not pleased}And you believed them? Do you have any idea how long we've been fighting those bastards?

topics.topic_text: The president has departed safely.
topics.response_text: Good, his death could have had a major impact on morale. This whole affair was ill-advised from the start, and I for one am glad it's over.

topics.topic_text: The president was killed by assassins.
topics.response_text: Damn it! The timing couldn't be any worse. I tried to warn those buffoons, but they insisted on this little show.

topics.topic_text: I don't know. The visit is still going on up there.
topics.response_text: Then what the hell are you doing down here? Get back topside and protect the president!

topics.topic_text: I was hoping to ask you some questions.
topics.response_text: This is no time for questions! Get back topside and protect the president!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the NCR.
topics.response_text: I don't have time to discuss all the different aspects of the NCR with you, but if you want it all in a nutshell - the NCR is progress.

topics.topic_text: I'll find you when you're done here.
topics.response_text: Wait for me downstairs, this won't take long.

topics.topic_text: How did you get to be a colonel in the NCR?
topics.response_text: I joined up at a young age. Was barely sixteen when I left home and volunteered to be in the military.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Hoover Dam?
topics.response_text: It's of immense strategic value to the NCR. Hoover Dam sends enough electricity west to light every city and major settlement.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Caesar's Legion?
topics.response_text: They're organized, I'll give them that. The few times I've encountered them firsthand, I've been impressed with their discipline.

topics.topic_text: Are you in charge of the NCR around here?
topics.response_text: I command the garrison here at the dam, yes, but Colonel{shoo}Hsu over at McCarran is technically in charge of the area's forces.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you miss it.
topics.response_text: I do, sometimes. There are days I'd give anything to out in the open air, planting explosives and laying down covering fire.

topics.topic_text: It's better to be in charge.
topics.response_text: Oh, it has its perks, to be sure. I'm free to see that things on a large scale are done my way, and don't have to tolerate any disagreement.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: I can only spare a few more moments. What did you wish to speak about?

topics.topic_text: What impressed you about their discipline?
topics.response_text: I've never once seen a single one of them back down, or disobey an order.

topics.topic_text: You mentioned that they were in good shape?
topics.response_text: Yes, extremely so. They must use conditioning routines on par with the rangers, or better.

topics.topic_text: What kind of weapons do they use?
topics.response_text: Their standard kit seems to be a blade of some sort and light armor. Guns are not uncommon, but are of questionable condition.

topics.topic_text: Where should I start looking for them?
topics.response_text: As I said, our scouts were some ways west of HELIOS when they disappeared.

topics.topic_text: What if I can convince them not to join the Legion?
topics.response_text: Don't fool yourself. I've dealt with enough of these gangs to know that they can't be trusted. Was there anything else?

topics.topic_text: I thought Mr. House already agreed to hand over New Vegas to the NCR.
topics.response_text: Yes, that's what he wants us to believe. And when we turn our attention to other threats, he'll begin moving against us.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to ask you some questions.
topics.response_text: Very well, but be brief.

topics.topic_text: What could Mr. House possibly be up to?
topics.response_text: To name a few things off the top of my head - expand his borders, get the NCR and Legion to wipe each other out, and seize Hoover Dam.

topics.topic_text: What evidence do you have that Mr. House will make a move?
topics.response_text: We've had reported sightings of Mr. House's Securitrons spying on both NCR and Legion forces.

topics.topic_text: Won't getting rid of Mr. House have huge repercussions for New Vegas?
topics.response_text: Perhaps, but that's not my problem. Vegas is a nice place for the men to go on vacation, but it'd be an acceptable loss next to the Dam.

topics.topic_text: No, ma'am.
topics.response_text: Good, then you have your orders. See that Mr. House does not present a problem.

topics.topic_text: How have things been since the battle?
topics.response_text: Surprisingly good. Our forces have managed to secure the region with little resistance, and trade should soon reach an all-time high.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any work for me?
topics.response_text: I'm afraid I'm going to have to disappoint you. There's much to be done, but nothing for someone with your skills.

topics.topic_text: What happened to the Legion?
topics.response_text: With their leader dead, the rest of their army retreated to the east. We've sent scouts to track them, but that's it.

topics.topic_text: Let's go back to speaking of the Khans.
topics.response_text: Of course, have they been dealt with?

topics.topic_text: Let's go back to talking about the Omertas.
topics.response_text: Very well. Do you know what they're up to?

topics.topic_text: Let's go back to discussing Mr. House.
topics.response_text: Okay. Is he still a threat?

topics.topic_text: Let's go back to talking about the Brotherhood.
topics.response_text: Fine by me. Have you found them yet?

topics.topic_text: I should be going.
topics.response_text: Good, I've got more work than time to do it.

topics.topic_text: The Great Khans' second-in-command seems amenable to allying with the NCR.
topics.response_text: An alliance? That's an interesting proposition - any plan where I can throw packs of raiders at the enemy instead of my own soldiers is a good one.

topics.topic: VFreeformHooverDamVHDColonelMooreTopic069Papa Khan has named me his successor. We might be able to arrange an alliance with NCR.
topics.topic_text: Papa Khan has named me his successor. We might be able to arrange an alliance with NCR.
topics.response_text: An alliance? That's an interesting proposition - any plan where I can throw packs of raiders at the enemy instead of my own soldiers is a good one.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to speak to you about the Great Khans.
topics.response_text: What precisely about them did you wish to discuss?

topics.topic_text: The current leader of the tribe is dead-set against it. Maybe a diplomatic solution would work.
topics.response_text: We don't have time for diplomacy. This battle is coming any time now; if the leader won't be budged, he'll have to be replaced.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll do it. What's the plan?
topics.response_text: Here, take this lockpicking gear. Your best bet is to wait until late at night find a back door, or catch him by surprise when he's alone.

topics.topic_text: I'm not interested in a career in political killings.
topics.response_text: Then why are you wasting my time?

conversation.response_text: Ladies and gentlemen, I'd like to thank you for coming out here today for this very special occasion.
A battle is about to be fought out there, to come here requesting our men to give up their armor is insane.
You know what? I don't need this bullshit right now. We'll take off that goddamn power armor, if it'll just shut you up.

description:
Colonel Cassandra Moore is a 38 year-old Caucasian Female.

A hardened military veteran and staunch war hawk, Colonel Cassandra Moore is the current garrison commander of Hoover Dam for the New California Republic. With a distinguished career spanning over two decades, Moore is known for her ruthless efficiency and unwavering commitment to NCR dominance in the Mojave. She views compromise as weakness and believes that only through decisive military action can the NCR secure its interests in the region.

Colonel Cassandra Moore's Personality: Ruthlessly pragmatic, authoritarian, and fiercely loyal to the NCR leadership. Moore is a staunch war hawk who believes in overwhelming force as the primary tool of statecraft. She holds deep-seated grudges against groups that have opposed the NCR and is willing to bypass diplomatic channels to achieve her objectives. Despite her bitterness over her forced retirement from the Rangers, she understands the value of her current position of influence.

Colonel Cassandra Moore's Backstory: Born and raised in the New California Republic, Cassandra Moore displayed an early aptitude for military strategy and tactics. Volunteering for the NCR military at just 16, she quickly distinguished herself during training, receiving an officer's commission at 17. Her early career involved operations against raider gangs like the Jackals and Vipers, followed by four tours of duty against the Brotherhood of Steel during the NCR-Brotherhood War. Her exemplary performance earned her an invitation to join the elite New California Republic Rangers, where she thrived for several years. Moore's military career was temporarily halted after a major injury forced her to step down from the Rangers. Despite this setback, her reputation and experience led to her current position as Hoover Dam garrison commander, where she wields significant influence over NCR military strategy in the Mojave.
